thread.title: UK weather: Violent 70mph gusts to batter Britain as a bitter Arctic bite sweeps in to cause rush hour mayhem - Mirror Online
thread.title_full: UK weather: Violent 70mph gusts to batter Britain as a bitter Arctic bite sweeps in to cause rush hour mayhem - Mirror Online

author: Bradley Jolly
title: UK weather: Violent 70mph gusts to batter Britain as a bitter Arctic bite sweeps in to cause rush hour mayhem - Mirror Online
text:
More furious gusts will cause chaos in the UK (Photo: Daily Mirror) Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Savage gales of up to 70mph and heavy rain will torment Britain as a harsh Arctic sting roars back in. 
Severe weather warnings of more devastating gusts are in place until Monday morning as the cold vortex shoves bitter winds across the country. 
Rush hour chaos is feared for parts of the UK, just days after the deadly Storm Doris terrorised the country. 
Met Office has stressed winds speeds could reach 70mph in some areas. Monster gales will batter our coastlines as the weather misery relents (Photo: www.alamy.com) Forecasters say more violent gusts of speeds of up to 70mph will pummel the UK (Photo: Daily Mirror) Read More 
"For many a short period of gusty winds are likely with speeds perhaps reaching 70mph in exposed locations whilst inland parts are more likely to see isolated gusts of 50-60mph. Some disruption to transport is possible," the weather warning stresses. 
Helen Roberts, meteorologist for Met Office, said: "Wind a real feature in the weather. 
"The winds will really start to pick up, strong and gusty southwesterly winds, giving gusts along western, exposed coasts and hills of England and Wales, and on up through the central belt of Scotland. 
"Because of the strength of the wind, there could well be some [travel] disruption." Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
